title: The Bodhisattva Jizō
medium: Japanese cypress wood (hinoki) with polychrome pigments, gold paint (kindei), cut gold leaf (kirikane), and rock-crystal eyes
dimensions: H (with pedestal) 53 1/2 in. (135.9 cm); W. 11 in. (27.9 cm)
creditLine: Metropolitan Museum of Art. Purchase, Florence and Herbert Irving Acquisitions Fund for Asian Art, Florence and Herbert Irving Acquisitions Fund, by exchange, The Miriam and Ira D. Wallach Foundation Fund, Brooke Russell Astor Bequest, and Fletcher Fund, 2023
